LocalizedStrings.enGB:
You've learned a way to increase the number of spells you can prepare per day.
Benefit: You can prepare four more spells per day of 1st, 2nd, and 3rd levels each. This ability only affects arcanist spellbooks.

You've mastered a way to increase the number of spells you can prepare per day.
Benefit: You can prepare four more spells per day of 7th, 8th, and 9th levels each. This ability only affects arcanist spellbooks.

You've studied a way to increase the number of spells you can prepare per day.
Benefit: You can prepare four more spells per day of 4th, 5th, and 6th levels each. This ability only affects arcanist spellbooks.
You wrap your body in force, gaining a +2 deflection bonus to AC. At caster level 6th and every 6 caster levels thereafter, this deflection bonus increases by +1 (to a maximum of +5 at 18th level).
You wrap your body in force, gaining a +2 deflection bonus to AC. At caster level 6th and every 6 caster levels thereafter, this deflection bonus increases by +1 (to a maximum of +5 at 18th level).

This spell functions like mage armor except you gain a +6 armor bonus. This bonus does not stack with other sources that grant an armor bonus.[LONGSTART]

An invisible but tangible field of force surrounds the subject of a mage armor spell, providing a +4 armor bonus to AC.
Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance. or speed redution. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal amror.[LONGEND]

This spell functions like mage armor except you gain a +6 armor bonus. This bonus does not stack with other sources that grant an armor bonus.[LONGSTART]

Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance. or speed redution. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal amror.[LONGEND]

This spell functions like mage armor except you gain a +10 armor bonus. This bonus does not stack with other sources that grant an armor bonus.[LONGSTART]

An invisible but tangible field of force surrounds the subject of a mage armor spell, providing a +4 armor bonus to AC.
Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance. or speed redution. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal amror.[LONGEND]

This spell functions like mage armor except you gain a +10 armor bonus. This bonus does not stack with other sources that grant an armor bonus.[LONGSTART]

An invisible but tangible field of force surrounds the subject of a mage armor spell, providing a +4 armor bonus to AC.
Unlike mundane armor, mage armor entails no armor check penalty, arcane spell failure chance. or speed redution. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal amror.[LONGEND]

This spell functions like shield, but its duration is longer and it can be employed like a tower shield for cover.[LONGSTART]

Shield creates an invisible shield of force that hovers in front of you. It negates magic missile attacks directed at you. The disk als oprovides a +4 shield bonus to AC. This bonus applies against incorporeal touch attacks, since it is a force effect. The shield has no armor check penalty or arcane spell failure.[LONGEND]
